description.narrative: By 2020, strengthened legal framework and justice services adequately respond to children in contact or in conflict with the law, which contributes to Birth Registration, Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change, Private Sector Engagement, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Innovation, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, the poorest and most marginalised children benefit from a more effective child and social protection system (cash and care)

description.narrative: With UNICEF’s contributions, the Civil Registration Vital Statistics (CRVS) agenda made significant progress in 2021, including:87,213;IDPs reached with birth registration in Cabo Delgado,birth registration campaigns, launch of a pilot project to strengthen the collaboration between civil registration and health delivery system in Zambezia Province, and opening of civil registration posts within health facilities countrywide. UNICEF also played a strategic role as co-chair of the United Nations Task Team;on Legal Identity Agenda, which supports efforts to strengthen the coordination of a UN response to legal identity issues, building on existing CRVS national plans and leveraging of available resources. | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:12/01/2022
